How can I get or set the index column name in a Pandas DataFrame in Python? I have the following DataFrame:

```python
             Column 1
Index Title          
Apples              1
Oranges             2
Puppies             3
Ducks               4 
```
I have tried the following code:

```python
import pandas as pd
data = {'Column 1'     : [1., 2., 3., 4.],
        'Index Title'  : ["Apples", "Oranges", "Puppies", "Ducks"]}
df = pd.DataFrame(data)
df.index = df["Index Title"]
del df["Index Title"]
print df
```
Unfortunately, it doesn't seem to work. Can anyone suggest how to do this?

In Pandas, if you want to set the index of a DataFrame and also give it a name, you can do so using the `set_index` method and then setting the `name` attribute of the index. Here's how you can achieve this based on your example:

```python
import pandas as pd

# Create the DataFrame
data = {
    'Column 1': [1., 2., 3., 4.],
    'Index Title': ["Apples", "Oranges", "Puppies", "Ducks"]
}
df = pd.DataFrame(data)

# Set 'Index Title' as the index
df.set_index('Index Title', inplace=True)

# Set the name of the index
df.index.name = 'Index Title'

print(df)
```

Output:
```
             Column 1
Index Title          
Apples              1
Oranges             2
Puppies             3
Ducks               4
```

In this code:
- `set_index('Index Title', inplace=True)` sets the 'Index Title' column as the index of the DataFrame and modifies the DataFrame in place.
- `df.index.name = 'Index Title'` assigns the name 'Index Title' to the index, so it appears in the output.

This should give you the desired DataFrame structure with the index column named 'Index Title'.
